info.name: Lissauer's tract
info.description: Lissauer's tract is AKA the dorsolateral fasciculus.  It is an area of spinal cord white matter located between the dorsal tip of the dorsal horn and the surface of the spinal cord. It consists of unmyelinated and thinly myelinated primary afferent axons from the lateral division of the dorsal root. These axons carry pain and temperature information and will synapse in the ipsilateral dorsal horn within a few cord segments.
